clinical_study.brief_title: CAPABLE for Frail Dually Eligible Older Adults
clinical_study.official_title: CAPABLE for Frail Dually Eligible Older Adults

collaborator.agency: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services

oversight_info.authority: United States: Data and Safety Monitoring Board

brief_summary.textblock: The Johns Hopkins School of Nursing offers this research study which aims to learn more about whether services that help with medications, muscle strengthening, pain management and changes to houses can help improve older adults' ability to, walk, and take care of themselves while saving costs by reducing hospitalizations and nursing home admissions.

detailed_description.textblock:
- 65yrs or older
- Be able to stand (with or without assistance)
- Have some difficulty with getting dressed, or preparing food, bathing
- Receive a low monthly income
- Have no plans to move in the next year
- NOT be receiving home nursing or other therapy right now

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Health Services Research

primary_outcome.time_frame: Time Points are assessed one year after the intervention for two years
primary_outcome.description: Primary aim is to test whether the CAPABLE intervention saves costs to Medicaid and Medicare relative to the cost of the intervention.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Outcomes Measures are assessed every four months up to one year
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary aim is to test whether the CAPABLE intervention decreases ADL and IADL limitations and increases Health Related Quality of Life in older adults with disabilities who have Medicaid and Medicare eligibility.

arm_group.description: The program consists of up to 10 home-based functional services sessions over 4 months.

intervention.intervention_name: 10 home-based functional services sessions over 4 months.
intervention.description: The program consists of up to 10 home-based functional services sessions over 4 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 65 or older
- Cognitively intact (≥ 10 on Brief Interview of Mental Status)
- Difficulty with ≥ 2 IADLS or ≥ 1 ADL
- ≤ 199% of Federal Poverty level
Exclusion Criteria:
- Terminally ill
--Active cancer treatment
- Hospitalized > 3 times in last 3 years
- Receiving home nursing, Occupational Therapy or Physical Therapy
- Don't have phone or do plan to move in less than a year
